intro: Cryptandra armata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland or shrubland environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
